course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Business Simulation and Strategic Decisions
course.description: This course combines a case study discussion approach to illustrate strategic decision making in business with an integrated hands-on business simulation exercise as part of the learning process.  Topics include making strategic choices and evaluating options and tradeoffs in a competitive business simulated industry environment.  The objective of the course is to develop a broad perspective in managerial decisions and an appreciation of economic and social factors that drive modern global organizations.

reviews.author: JM48
reviews.title: One of the most interesting class!
reviews.comment_content: The whole course is about a simulation game. Each group will act as a company and make decision in different departments like marketing and production. It is very fun and your whole team can build a great bond.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor has a lot of knowledge in different aspects and you can learn a lot from him. He is also very nice and friendly so you can chat with him like friends. However, the way he talked maybe a little bored, especially in a 3-hr lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is very good with its light workload. My team performed quite well and had good luck through the course. Although my essay is just mean, I can still obtain a A+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. You just need a short meeting with your team each week and a online meeting is good enough. There are only two case studies which are only two short essays.

reviews.author: gupta
reviews.comment_content:
business cases are very interesting, what you do in class is quite boring.

the simulation, which is the main point of the course is fun - but you have to work diligently to get a good grade.

make an excel sheet.
done.

reviews.author: YEEEboi
reviews.title: One of the best courses in UST
reviews.comment_content:
The entire course involves Capsim the business simulation game. Each group will act as a firm and make decisions in various departments such as R&D, marketing, production, etc.

The course will later transition from corporate and business strategies into personal strategies that can be applied in life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Clark is amazing. He's intelligent, fun, and great to talk with. Parts of the content of the course might become a bit dull and some point since it's a 3-hour course. However, most of the materials and suggestions he provides in class are really useful and worth a thought in many aspects.

Furthermore, feel free to talk to him after class. He personally provided me with many useful tips and suggestions for my incoming career and work-life balance. His intelligence and background make him a professor you wouldn't want to miss in UST.
reviews.comment_grading:
Individual participation 20%
Individual simulation 10%
Group simulation 40%
Final exam 30%

Grading is great, I believe our entire team got A range since our group simulation was quite good. The exam was easy as well. Personally got A+ in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Really light workload. It's just all about the simulation game.

reviews.author: JCCC
reviews.title: A course you wouldn't want to miss
reviews.comment_content: You get hands on experience in managing a company through a simulation game which will be very useful when you start working, as you will understand how different departments across a company work hand in hand. Also the professor teaches many important life skills like the art of war in the business world.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is really nice and willing to teach you things and also hes really smart! He always welcomes questions and likes it when students find him outside of class.
reviews.comment_grading:
You will be assessed on your performance in the simulation, 2 case studies, attendance and a final exam. However, everything apart from the simulation does not really affect your final grade. Do well in the game and the A is yours.

For the final exam, it is MC + essay question. However, he tells you the essay question in advance, so you can prepare for it.
reviews.comment_workload: One of the courses with the least workload that I have ever taken. Because the game is super fun, it didn't feel like much work. If you don't have time for games, spending a few minutes every week to make your decisions will be sufficient to get a good grade.

reviews.author: uo3626
reviews.title: Interesting simulation game, boring lectures
reviews.comment_content: Content of lecture is quite boring and not very helpful for the simulation game. First 2 lectures were introductory and about high-level stuffs. Then, in each week's lecture the professor talks about the performance of simulation game of each team. There were 2 lectures in the middle about the 2 cases.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very friendly and humorous. But the way lectures are a bit boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Individual participation (20%) – not hard to get. answer/ask some questions in lectures, participate in breakout room when the TA/professor is here
Individual assignments (20%) – quite hard to get above mean, but doesn't affect the grade much
Group business simulation (40%) – depend on some luck, but if you have some good team mates, it wouldn't be too bad
Final Exam (20%) - roughly 70% about simulation game, 30% about the cases, straight forward questions
reviews.comment_workload:
Individual participation (20%) – TA marks attendance and participation manually every lecture
Individual assignments (20%) – cases are quite long. spend 2-3 days for each. 2 cases in total.
Group business simulation (40%) – expect a meeting every week. But you got time to discuss in breakout room every lecture. If you do it fast you don't need extra meeting to come up with decisions.
Final Exam (20%) - If you have participated during simulation game, the 70% part about the simulation won't be hard. But still you need to memorise the team member guide a bit before the exam. Take a look at the cases to remember what's on the case.

reviews.author: Hosea
reviews.title: Fun course!
reviews.comment_content:
The whole course is based on a simulation game called CAPSIM (as mentioned by many other reviews).

In the first three weeks, lectures about strategic positioning and strategy execution are given. An overview on the game is also given.

Before the real game starts, a few weeks are spent on the practice rounds to give students a taste of how the game is like, and as a warm up for those who need some time to familiarize themselves with the game. The game is played against fellow student teams in the class. There were 3 practice rounds in Spring 2017 - not sure if the number is different in other semesters.

The real game lasts for 8 rounds. In the first few rounds, students have more time to make decisions for the game. However, the decision making time is reduced gradually - only 1 hour was given for the decisions in round 8 when compared to a full week in round 1. As the game proceeds, the game becomes more and more challenging.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Hui is knowledgeable. He has numerous real-life examples in many different scenarios to explain his materials. While going through the lectures, he introduced a lot of discussions to help us apply the strategies. The lectures are not just useful in business field, but can be useful in other areas as well. He is also very responsive to questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grades are heavily dependent on the RESULTS of the game. In this particular semester, the game alone took up 50% of the course grade - 10% from the practice rounds and 40% from the competition rounds. This part is a zero-sum game - you are literally graded against your competitors in the game. It is almost when you gain one point, the others lose one point. This can be frustrating when you are on the disadvantaged side.

If your team is not performing well (no matter because of bad luck or bad strategy), hopefully the rest of the 50% can save your grades - 20% for a simple group presentation, 20% for attendance, class participation and online quiz (if you finish it, you gain full credits, don't worry - it's more like an assignment to make sure you know the game rules), and 10% for 2 written assignments.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload depends on your commitment. The group presentations and written assignments are easy. When working on the written assignments the hardest part is to keep my work within 4 pages (double-spaced).

However, the workload for the game varies a lot - you can choose to randomly come up with some decisions and put them into the system, or scrutinize the game financial reports, do a lot of calculations and carefully plan your actions.

Good news: no exams!

reviews.author: Blackcat
reviews.title: Learning by playing the simulation
reviews.comment_content: The whole course is about winning the simulation game. You will be assigned to a group and your group will be competing with the other 5 groups. The better your performance in the simulation, the better your grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course will be once a week, 3 hours long. But most of the time, students are free to leave at the first 1 hour as the remaining 2 hours are designed for group discussions.
reviews.comment_grading: It depends on how your team perform. Also, luck plays an important role in this simulation. If the other groups mess up, chances of winning the game is bigger.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. There are 2 case studies, 1 reflection essay, and weekly group discussions.

reviews.author: lychau
reviews.comment_content: The lecture design is fun. With around 80% throughout the semester students will be divided into groups and discuss about strateges for CAPSIM in different breakout rooms. There are not much revising need for this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecturer is a bit dull. However lecture is fun as it's like a mini case competition throughout the semester.However in
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is heavily dependent on the online simulation result. It is important to get a good team. If it happens that the other 5 teams from your world is strong then you might end up with bad grade.

The following are the grading distribution:

• 20% (participation+online capsim tutorial and quiz (will get a decent mark as long as you complete it))
• 20% (2 essays + reflective essay)
• 40% online simulation result
20% final exam (easy TF question, MC and strategy analysis)
reviews.comment_workload: Since almost no revision is needed for this course. And there are only 1 lecture per week. The workload is extremely light, making it a very pleasure playing experience. Other than the capsim online simulation there are essays which may require more workload.
